title: Reminiscences of Scottish life and character
snippet: It is well known that private stills were prevalent in the Highlands fifty or sixty years ago, and no one thought there was any harm in them. This good bishop, whose name I forget, was (as I heard the late W. Mackenzie of Muirton assure a party at Dunrobin Castle)^ several years previously a famous hand at brewing a good glass of whisky, and that he distributed his mountain dew with a liberal and impartial hand alike to Catholic and to Protestant friends. Of this class, I recollect, certainly fortyfive  years ago, priest Gordon, a genuine Aberdonian , and a man beloved by all, rich and poor.
